items.sentence: How many times did you go swimming last month?
I thought Tom would be out partying with Mary.
I wonder whether or not Tom will go to Boston.
I can\'t remember the names of Tom\'s sisters.
Apparently, the brakes on the bus were faulty.
Tom is only a couple of years older than Mary.
Nobody can see this movie without being moved.
Did Tom really do that without anyone\'s help?
I don\'t know if I can go to the party or not.
Tom has an extremely expressive singing voice.
Are you planning to go to Australia next year?
Tom told us to make sure we got there on time.
Tom took a beer from the cooler and opened it.
Tom doesn\'t have a French-English dictionary.
Don\'t ever let me catch you doing this again.
Tom expected Mary to be a little more helpful.
Tom failed the test, just like Mary predicted.
Tom felt as if he had been punched in the gut.
Tom felt guilty about yelling at his daughter.
I promise you that I\'ll be there to help you.
Someone broke into my car and stole my guitar.
Tom has been charged with first degree murder.
I couldn\'t understand what he was getting at.
I\'m not sure I want to know what\'s going on.
I don\'t like the kind of food that Tom makes.
I don\'t think that Tom would let you do that.
Tom makes it a rule not to eat after 8:00 p.m.
I\'m getting very little cooperation from Tom.
I don\'t feel like dealing with Tom right now.
I can\'t tell you how sad I am about all this.
Do you think you\'ll ever move back to Boston?
I think you\'ve mistaken me for somebody else.
Tom didn\'t have enough money to pay his rent.
I\'m convinced my daughter will pass the exam.
Tom surrounds himself with like-minded people.
Tom takes a bath every day just before dinner.
Tom talked to himself as he washed the dishes.
I can barely make myself understood in French.
My wife and I have grown apart over the years.
I want you to call me back as soon as you can.
That\'s the tallest tree that I\'ve ever seen.
Tom was dressed in clothes similar to John\'s.
I hope Tom doesn\'t go to Boston next weekend.
I hope that I don\'t get kicked out of school.
I assume you\'ll be taking a leave of absence.
It\'s a good thing that you were able to help.
We have to go there whether we like it or not.
We heard some strange noises during the night.
I don\'t think Tom knows who broke the window.
I don\'t want to drive back to Boston tonight.
